fields.name: Northern District of Illinois
fields.court_name: U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the Northern District of Illinois

fields.description: Protects up to $15,000 in equity in your primary residence. Married couples filing jointly can double this to $30,000 if they jointly own the home.
Protects up to $2,400 in equity in one motor vehicle. Joint filers can double this amount if both names are on the title.
Protects up to $4,000 in value of any personal property other than real estate. Married couples filing jointly can protect up to $8,000 in additional assets.
Protects up to $1,500 in tools, equipment, or professional books you use to earn a living. This helps tradespeople, contractors, and professionals keep the items they need to work.

fields.title: Mailing Matrix Requirements
fields.description: Debtors must file a mailing matrix (list of creditors) in addition to the creditor matrix included with schedules. The matrix must be uploaded separately in the prescribed format for the Northern District of Illinois.

fields.title: Chapter 13 Plan Requirements
fields.description: Chapter 13 plans in the Northern District must use the court-approved form plan. The plan must include specific language regarding treatment of secured claims and priority debts as outlined in the local rules.

fields.title: Pro Se E-Filing Procedures
fields.description: Pro se debtors (self-represented filers) are permitted to file electronically in the Northern District of Illinois. Pro se filers must register for CM/ECF access through the court's registration process and comply with all electronic filing requirements.
